Mike Pence , R-Ind., announced Thursday that he would not run for president in 2012. We have been especially humbled by the confidence and support of those who believe we should pursue the presidency, but after much deliberation and prayer, we believe our calling is closer to home, Mike Pence said in a letter to supporters. ''In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana. We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012.''

who has led Google for a decade, will become executive chairman focusing on external relations, deals and government relations.New Yorker writer Ken Auletta , who has written a book on the company, reported Friday that Eric Schmidt had been nudged aside. '' Ken Auletta said that after losing out to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin over the company's China policy a year ago, '' Eric Schmidt lost some energy and focus. '' Eric Schmidt was also criticized for allowing Google to be overtaken by Facebook, for the company's increasingly frequent privacy scandals and its increasing internal bureaucracy. Together with the co- founders, he decided to step aside.In announcing the move Thursday, Eric Schmidt said that the company no longer needed his ''adult supervision and that Page, 38, was ready to run the world's leading internet company.
